title: The Emotional Radar
description: Feelings, emotions, likes and dislikes. Moving from physical states to emotional literacy.

episodes.intro: You can say you are hungry. You can say you are tired. But can you say you are HAPPY? Feelings start today.
episodes.scenario: Your child says their first Tamil word. Wife says 'I'm so happy!'. Grandma says 'I feel proud'. You feel both.

episodes.intro: The dark side. Anger when the auto cheats you. Fear when you see the cockroach. Essential survival emotions.
episodes.scenario: Auto driver charges double. You feel angry. Wife says 'Don't be angry'. You see a huge cockroach in the bathroom. Now you feel fear. Wife laughs.

episodes.intro: The quiet emotions. The ones that sit in the chest. Worry when Mom calls from abroad. Sadness when friends leave.
episodes.scenario: Mom calls from abroad. She worries about you. You say 'Don't worry'. Friend is leaving Chennai. You feel sad. At a family function, someone praises your Tamil. You feel shy.

episodes.intro: The preference system. This is how you build a personality in Tamil. I like this. I don't like that.
episodes.scenario: Friend asks about food. You like dosa. You don't like bitter gourd. Wife's preference is biryani. What is your favorite movie? 'I like Rajini movies'.

episodes.intro: A movie scene described to you. Identify and express four different emotions as the scene unfolds.
episodes.scenario: Scene: Hero gets a promotion (happy). Villain threatens his family (fear). His friend betrays him (angry). His mother is alone at home (worry). Express each emotion as you hear the story.

episodes.intro: Audit Day. The emotion vocabulary drill.
episodes.scenario: Rapid fire. I describe a situation, you name the emotion.

episodes.intro: Emotions in Tamil don't happen TO you. They happen FOR you. The 'Enakku + emotion' pattern that unlocks all feelings.

vocab.english: I am happy (lit: to me, joy)
I am scared (lit: to me, it is fearful)
I am worried (lit: to me, it is worrisome)

episodes.scenario: Understanding the dative pattern. English says 'I am happy'. Tamil says 'To me, happiness exists'. This pattern works for ALL emotions and is the key to sounding natural.
